text:
Organizations running tightly coupled, compute-intensive,
HPC workloads

that are migrating to the cloud need flexible
options that maximize performance
while optimizing costs.
That’s why Amazon EC2 Hpc7g instances
powered by AWS Graviton processors
are designed to deliver up to 60% better performance

over comparable previous-generation
Amazon EC2 instances.

And Graviton3-based instances use up to 60%
less energy
for the same performance than comparable EC2 instances.

Hpc7g instances are ideal for running computational
fluid dynamics simulations

to improve product designs and develop viable
prototypes,
including automotive, aerospace and energy.

These instances are ideal for weather forecasting
too.

Elastic Fabric Adapter, powered by the AWS
Nitro System
delivers 200 Gbps for low latency

and high network performance for MPI-based
applications.

Hpc7g offers up to 64 cores of Arm-based AWS
Graviton3E processors
with 128 GiB of memory
with 16, 8 and 4 GB/core options.

This gives you the flexibility to manage workload
costs
by selecting the appropriate cores needed.

Get the most from running your HPC workloads
on AWS to solve complex scientific, academic,
and business problems.
Start today with Amazon EC2 Hpc7g instances.
